intro: Encyclia parkeri, commonly known as the Mexican sun orchid, is a terrestrial orchid native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It features a sympodial growth habit with a short rhizome and a single, fleshy, green stem. The plant produces showy, fragrant flowers in shades of yellow and orange, often with a distinctive red or orange lip. Its leaves are elliptical,革质 (leathery), and arranged in a rosette pattern. Encyclia parkeri thrives in warm, humid environments and is often found in shaded, well-drained forest soils.
